byline.contributor: Edward Wong reported from Beijing, and Mujib Mashal from Kabul, Afghanistan. Yufan Huang contributed research from Beijing.
byline.original: By EDWARD WONG and MUJIB MASHAL

abstract: Representatives of Afghan government and former members of country's old Taliban government attend meeting in China with hope of encouraging formal peace negotiations; meeting is organized by China as well as Pakistani officials, who both have interest in ending Afghanistan's 13-year civil war.
lead_paragraph: Afghan government representatives said at the meeting that it was ready to make an effort to build trust, if the Taliban agreed to peace negotiations.

headline.main: Taliban and Afghan Peace Officials Have Secret Talks in China
headline.print_headline: Taliban Representatives Meet With Afghan Envoy in China

snippet: Afghan government representatives said at the meeting that it was ready to make an effort to build trust, if the Taliban agreed to peace negotiations.
